title: Alternating Digit Sum

solutions.content:
- Time complexity:
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->
$$O(n)$$

If You like the Solution, Don't Forget To UpVote Me, Please UpVote! 🔼🙏
# Python3
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        s=str(n)
        ans=0
        for i in range(0,len(s),2):
            ans+=int(s[i])
        for i in range(1,len(s),2):
            ans-=int(s[i])
        return ans
```

solutions.content:
We iterate right to left, and if necessary, flip the sign of the answer to correct the sum at the end.
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:

        ans, sign = 0, 1

        while n:
            sign^= -2               # <-- flips 1 to-1 and -1 to 1
            n, rem = divmod(n,10)
            ans+= sign*rem
            
        return  sign*ans
```
[https://leetcode.com/problems/alternating-digit-sum/submissions/883217603/]()

solutions.content:
# Complexity
- Time ```O(N) #where N is number of digits```
- Space ```O(1)```

# Code
```
class Solution(object):
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n):
        n = str(n)
        sum_, flag = 0, True
        for ch in n:
            sum_ += int(ch) if flag else -int(ch)
            flag = not flag
        return sum_
```

```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        x=str(n)
        list1=[]
        list2=[]
        for i in range(len(x)):
            if i%2==0:
                list1.append(int(x[i]))
            else:
                list2.append(int(x[i]))
        return sum(list1)-sum(list2)

```

solutions.content:
<!-- # Intuition -->
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

<!-- # Approach -->
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

# Complexity 
- Time complexity:  O(length of n)
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

- Space complexity: O(1)
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->
# Code
```
class Solution {
public:
    int alternateDigitSum(int n) {
        int ans=0;
        bool flag=true;
        int len = log10(n)+1;   //length of n
        
        if(len%2==0)
            flag=false;
        
        while(n){
            int rem = n%10;
            
            n/=10;
                
            if(flag){
                ans += rem;
            }
            else{
                ans -=rem;
            }
            
            flag=!flag;
            
        }
        return ans;
    }
};
```

solutions.content:
# Complexity
- Time complexity:
O(n) - Beats 88%
- Space complexity:
Beats 94%
# Code
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        sum,c = 0,1
        s = str(n)
        for i in s:
            if c % 2 == 0:
                sum = sum + ((-1)*int(i))
            else:
                sum = sum + int(i)
            c+=1
        return sum
```

class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        sm_e=0
        sm_o=0
        sn=str(n)
        for i in range(len(sn)):
            if i&1==0:
                sm_e+=int(sn[i])
            else:
                sm_o+=int(sn[i])
        return sm_e-sm_o
            
```

solutions.content:
# Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->
Don't use strings, use math!
# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->
 * It doesn't matter from right to left or vice versa to add and subtract digits.
* Adjacent digits have opposite signs.
* There're two sums of digits with odd and even places.
* The result is the difference between the sums.
* The sign of the result depends on parity of the number length. 
# Complexity
- Time complexity:
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->
$$O(log(N))$$: For place-value notation with radix 10, the length of a number $$N$$ is $$log(N) + 1$$.
- Space complexity:
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->
$$O(1)$$: Only two variables are needed.

---
* You could find some other extraordinary solutions in my [profile](https://leetcode.com/almostmonday/) on the Solutions tab (I don't post obvious or not interesting solutions at all.)
* If this was helpful, please upvote so that others can see this solution too.
---

# Code
```
class Solution(object):
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n):
        res = 0
        sign = 1
        while n:
            res += n % 10 * sign
            sign = -sign
            n //= 10

        return res * -sign
```

```

solutions.content:
# Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->First approach was how to take out the first digit(from the left) of the number. For doing this, first I need to know the length of the digit. 

# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. --> Firstly I have converted the number to string form, to get the length of the number. Now, I have got the length of that number. Now, a loop to the length of that number is generated and inside the loop, I have firstly found the first digit (from the left), of the number and now removed that digit from the number. If the digit is on odd place, adding that to the sum else, subtracting it from the sum. Now, I have found the sum and returned the same.  
 

# Code
```
class Solution(object):
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n):
        """
        :type n: int
        :rtype: int
        """
        a=str(n)
        le=len(a)
        s=0
        for i in range(1,le+1):
            a=n//10**(le-i)
            n=n%10**(le-i)
            if i%2==0:
                s-=a
            else:
                s+=a
        return s
```
solutions.code:
```
class Solution(object):
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n):
        """
        :type n: int
        :rtype: int
        """
        a=str(n)
        le=len(a)
        s=0
        for i in range(1,le+1):
            a=n//10**(le-i)
            n=n%10**(le-i)
            if i%2==0:
                s-=a
            else:
                s+=a
        return s
```

solutions.content:
<!-- # Intuition -->
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

# Approach
Convert **int** `n` to **string** `s`.
Keep **adding** digit at *even* index and **substract** digit at *odd* index .
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

# Complexity
- Time complexity: *O(n)*
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution {
public:
    int alternateDigitSum(int n) {
        
        int ans=0;
        string s=to_string(n);
        for(int i=0;i<s.size();i++)
        {
            if(i%2==0)ans+=(s[i]-'0');
            else ans-=(s[i]-'0');
        }
        return ans;
    }
};
```

solutions.content:
<!-- # Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

<!-- # Approach --> -->
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

# Complexity
- Time complexity:O(n)
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

<!-- - Space complexity: -->
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution {
public:
    int alternateDigitSum(int n) {
        vector<int>temp;
        while(n>0){
            int r=n%10;
            temp.push_back(r);
            n=n/10;
        }
        int k=temp.size();
        int ans=0;
        if(k%2==0){
            for(int i=k-1; i>=0; i--){
                if(i%2==1){
                    ans=ans+temp[i];
                }
                else{
                    ans=ans-temp[i];
                }
            }
        }
        else{
            for(int i=k-1; i>=0; i--){
                if(i%2==1){
                    ans=ans-temp[i];
                }
                else{
                    ans=ans+temp[i];
                }
            }
        }
        return ans;
    }
};
```

<!-- # Intuition -->
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

<!-- # Approach -->
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

<!-- # Complexity -->
<!-- - Time complexity: -->
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

<!-- - Space complexity: -->
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution {
public:
    int alternateDigitSum(int n) {
        vector<int> v;
        int ans=0;
        while(n > 0)
        {
            v.push_back(n % 10);
            n = n / 10;
        }
        reverse(v.begin(), v.end());
        for(int i = 0; i < v.size(); i++)
        {
            if(i % 2 == 0)
                ans += v[i];
            else
                ans -= v[i];
        }
        return ans;
    }
};
```

solutions.content:
# Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

# Complexity
- Time complexity: O(1) (actually O(length(n)) that is constant)
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

- Space complexity: O(1)
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
impl Solution {
    pub fn alternate_digit_sum(n: i32) -> i32 {
        n
        .to_string()
        .chars()
        .map(|x| x as i32 - 48)
        .enumerate()
        .fold(0, |acc, (i, x)| acc + if i & 0b1 == 0 {x} else {-x})
    }
}
```

solutions.content:
# Complexity
- Time complexity: $$O(n)$$
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

- Space complexity: $$O(n)$$
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```python
class Solution:
  def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
    sign = -1
    sum_ = 0
    for num_str in str(n):
      sign *= -1
      sum_ += sign * int(num_str)
    return sum_
```

solutions.content:
# Complexity
- Time complexity: 15ms
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

- Space complexity: 13.25 MB
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution(object):
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n):
        """
        :type n: int
        :rtype: int
        """
        tupe = tuple(str(n))
        list1 = [int(item) for item in tupe]
        sum1 = 0
        num1 = 0
        num = 1
        count = 0
        for i in list1:
            if count%2==1:
                num1 = -(i)
            else:
                num1 = i
            sum1 = sum1+num1
            count += 1
        return sum1
```

solutions.title: easy-solution-1-line
solutions.content:
# Complexity
- Time complexity:
O(d) -> d is number of digits in n

- Space complexity:
O(1)

# Code
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        return sum(int(d) * (-1 if i % 2 else 1) for i, d in enumerate(str(n)))
```

Please let me know if any improvements can be made.

Thanks

solutions.content:
# Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

# Complexity
- Time complexity:
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

- Space complexity:
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        x=0
        y=str(n)
        i=0
        while(i<len(y)):
            if i%2==0:
                x=x+int(y[i])
                i+=1
            else:
                x=x-int(y[i])
                i+=1
        return x
       

        
```

solutions.content:
# Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

# Complexity
- Time complexity:
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

- Space complexity:
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution(object):
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n):
        """
        :type n: int
        :rtype: int
        """
        re=0
        for i in range(len(str(n))):
            if i%2==0:
                re+=int(str(n)[i])
            else:
                re-=int(str(n)[i])
        return re        
```

solutions.content:
# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->
We use `map(int, str(n))` to iterate over the digits of `n`, and then
use the fact that $$(-1)^i$$ alternates between $$+1$$ and $$-1$$ to complete the solution.

# Complexity
- Time complexity: $$O(n)$$
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        return sum((-1)**i * digit for i, digit in enumerate(map(int, str(n))))
```

### Please Upvote if you liked the solution.

solutions.content:
# Code
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        m = str(n)
        l = len(m)
        s = 0
        z = 0 
        for i in range(0, l, 2):
            s += int(m[i])
        for j in range(1, l, 2):
            z += int(m[j])
        return s - z
```
## Please Upvote!

solutions.title: simple-python-solution-o-1-space-and-o-n-time-with-explanation-in-comments
solutions.content:
# Code
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        #First find the len of the number
        numLen = len(str(n))

        result = 0
        
        #Note for the first iteration the operation and the divisor values
        #need to be set outside the loop

        #variable to store the operation to be performed 
        operation = 'add'

        #the number we need to divide by to get the most siginigicant digit
        # power needs to be numLen - 1
        divisor = pow(10, numLen - 1) 

        while n > 0:
            #Getting the most significant digit
            # Note to get the msd, we need to divide by the divisor
            msd = int(n / divisor)

            #depending on the operation, add or subtract the digit from the result
            if operation == 'add':
                result += msd
            else:
                result -= msd

            #update the num, divisor  and the operation for the next iteration of the while loop

            n = n % divisor #Again to find the new number , it is the mode function
            #that needs to be used
            #the reverse of what we need to do when we are pulling digits friom the least
            #siginificant position

            #The operation needs to be flipped
            if operation == 'add':
                operation = 'subtract'
            else:
                operation = 'add'

            divisor = divisor / 10

        
        return result



            



```
solutions.code:
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        #First find the len of the number
        numLen = len(str(n))

        result = 0
        
        #Note for the first iteration the operation and the divisor values
        #need to be set outside the loop

        #variable to store the operation to be performed 
        operation = 'add'

        #the number we need to divide by to get the most siginigicant digit
        # power needs to be numLen - 1
        divisor = pow(10, numLen - 1) 

        while n > 0:
            #Getting the most significant digit
            # Note to get the msd, we need to divide by the divisor
            msd = int(n / divisor)

            #depending on the operation, add or subtract the digit from the result
            if operation == 'add':
                result += msd
            else:
                result -= msd

            #update the num, divisor  and the operation for the next iteration of the while loop

            n = n % divisor #Again to find the new number , it is the mode function
            #that needs to be used
            #the reverse of what we need to do when we are pulling digits friom the least
            #siginificant position

            #The operation needs to be flipped
            if operation == 'add':
                operation = 'subtract'
            else:
                operation = 'add'

            divisor = divisor / 10

        
        return result



            



```

solutions.title: java-100-solution
mathematical-way
solutions.content:
# Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->

# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

# Complexity
- Time complexity:
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

- Space complexity:
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->

# Code
```
class Solution {
    func alternateDigitSum(_ n: Int) -> Int {
        guard n>0 else {return 0}
        var nString = String(n)
        nString = String(nString.reversed())
        var nNum = Int(nString)!
        var sum = 0
        var flag = 0
        while nNum/10 != 0 {
            sum = flag==0 ? sum+nNum%10 : sum-nNum%10
            flag = flag==0 ? flag+1 : flag-1
            nNum /= 10
        }
        
        sum = flag==0 ? sum+nNum : sum-nNum
        return sum
    }
}
```

solutions.title: easy-solution-java
python-one-liner
solutions.content:
# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->

The problem requires us to add / substract alternate digits in the number starting from the left.

So for ```n = 521``` we want to do the sum of the numbers ```[5, -2, 1]```

The task of separating out the digits can be done easily by converting the number into a string and iterating over it.

```
[ int(i) for i in (str(n)) ]
```

So for ```n = 521``` we will get the list ```[5, 2, 1]```

But we would like this to be ```[5, -2, 1]```. Another way of writing the same is ```[5*(-1)**0, 2*(-1)**1, 1*(-1)**2 ]```

Where ```0, 1, 2 ``` are the index positions of the digits starting from the left. We can easily generate this information using ```enumerate```.

```
[int(i)*(-1)**idx for idx,i in enumerate(str(n))]
```

Now all that is left is to sum this list.

Please note the computing the exponent is definitely computationally more expensive as the $$length$$ of the number increases compared to a simple iterative approach.

# Code
```
class Solution:
    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:
        return sum([int(i)*(-1)**idx for idx,i in enumerate(str(n))])
```
solutions.code:
```n = 521```
```[5, -2, 1]```
```\n[ int(i) for i in (str(n)) ]\n```
```n = 521```
```[5, 2, 1]```
```[5, -2, 1]```
```[5*(-1)**0, 2*(-1)**1, 1*(-1)**2 ]```
```0, 1, 2 ```
```enumerate```
```\n[int(i)*(-1)**idx for idx,i in enumerate(str(n))]\n```
```\nclass Solution:\n    def alternateDigitSum(self, n: int) -> int:\n        return sum([int(i)*(-1)**idx for idx,i in enumerate(str(n))])\n```

content.content:
According to the site [Datacademia](https://datacadamia.com/data/type/number/significant#:~:text=Definition%20Most%20The%20most%20significant%20digit%20is%20the,least%20significant%20digit%20is%20the%20right-most%20known%20digit.) the formal definition of **Most Significant Digit** is:
> The ***most significant digit** is the **left-most nonzero digit** 
> Where as The least significant digit is the right-most known digit.

Thus :
- `n=25` :  (+2) + (-5)  = -3
- `n=521` : (+5) + (-2) + (+1) = 4
- `n=1234` : (+1) + (-2) + (+3) + (-4) = -2
- `n=886996` : (+8) + (-8) + (+6) + (-9) + (+9) + (-6) = 0
Hope it helps.
thanks a lot
\'The most significant digit\' part got me.

If you\'re interested how to use math instead of strings, indexes and arrays, the solution is [here](https://leetcode.com/problems/alternating-digit-sum/solutions/3352079/python-pure-math-o-1-space-o-log-n-time-without-any-string-or-array/). One pass, O(1) space, pure math.
Think about what happen when the index is odd or even :)
\uFF1F\uFF1F\uFF1F\uFF1F\uFF1F\uFF1F\uFF1F\uFF1F

- `n=25` :  (+2) + (-5)  = -3
- `n=521` : (+5) + (-2) + (+1) = 4
- `n=1234` : (+1) + (-2) + (+3) + (-4) = -2
- `n=886996` : (+8) + (-8) + (+6) + (-9) + (+9) + (-6) = 0
Hope it helps.
